definitions: degree of importance or relevance affecting decision-making or understanding
quality of having physical substance or tangible existence
examples: The materiality of the error required immediate disclosure
Auditors assess the materiality threshold before issuing reports
Questions about the materiality of consciousness remain philosophical debates
The artist explores the materiality of paint on canvas

definitions: military equipment, supplies, and weapons used by armed forces
examples: The convoy transported essential materiel to the forward base
Military materiel includes vehicles, ammunition, and communication equipment

definitions: state or period of being a mother, especially during pregnancy and after childbirth
hospital department specializing in care for pregnant women and newborns
examples: She took six months of maternity leave after the birth
The company improved its maternity benefits policy last year
The maternity ward was renovated with private birthing suites
She works as a nurse in the maternity unit

definitions: informal term for mathematics as an academic subject or calculation
examples: She excels at math and science in school
The math homework took three hours to complete

definitions: person who studies or has expertise in mathematics professionally
examples: The mathematician proved the long-standing conjecture last year
Famous mathematicians like Euler transformed our understanding of numbers

definitions: theatrical or cinema performance held in the afternoon rather than evening
examples: We caught the matinee showing to avoid the crowds
The Saturday matinee attracts families with young children

definitions: sexual pairing of animals or organisms for reproduction purposes
process of fitting or joining two parts together mechanically
examples: The mating season for deer occurs in autumn months
Scientists observed the birds' elaborate mating rituals in detail
Ensure proper mating of the connector pins before powering on
The mating surfaces must be clean for proper seal

definitions: woman who rules or dominates a family, group, or state
examples: The family matriarch made all important decisions for generations
She became the matriarch after her mother passed away

definitions: final year of high school or qualification certificate in some educational systems
examples: She passed her matric exams with distinction last year
The matric dance is a major event for final-year students

definitions: formal process of entering or being enrolled at a university or college
examples: Matriculation ceremonies welcome new students to the university each fall
She completed her matriculation requirements before the semester began

definitions: formal state of being married or the ceremony of marriage itself
examples: They entered into holy matrimony at the cathedral last spring
The bonds of matrimony united the two families together

definitions: rectangular array of numbers arranged in rows and columns for calculations
substance within which something else originates, develops, or is contained
organizational structure where employees report to multiple managers
examples: The matrix multiplication yielded unexpected results in the calculation
She used matrices to solve the system of linear equations
The fossil was embedded in a matrix of sedimentary rock
Cells develop within the extracellular matrix of tissues
The company adopted a matrix structure for project management
Working in a matrix organization requires strong communication skills

definitions: senior nursing officer in charge of medical staff in a hospital
dignified married woman, especially one of mature age and established social position
examples: The matron supervised all nursing staff on the ward
She served as matron of the hospital for twenty years
The society matrons organized the annual charity gala event
Victorian matrons maintained strict household standards and social protocols

definitions: surface finish or coating that lacks shine or glossiness
examples: The photographer preferred matt prints for the exhibition display
Choose a matt varnish for a non-reflective furniture finish

definitions: surface or finish that has no shine or luster
technique in filmmaking combining separately filmed elements into single shots
examples: The matte lipstick provides long-lasting coverage without shine
Artists often choose matte medium for subtle texture effects
The matte painting created realistic backgrounds for the scene
Digital matte techniques replaced traditional glass painting methods

definitions: coarse woven material used as floor covering or protective surface
cardboard border placed around a picture within its frame
examples: The rubber matting prevents slips in the gym area
We installed new matting at the building entrance
The artwork looks better with cream-colored matting around it
Professional matting enhances the presentation of photographs significantly

definitions: process of becoming mature or fully developed physically, mentally, or emotionally
examples: The wine's maturation process takes several years in oak barrels
Adolescent brain maturation continues into the mid-twenties

definitions: state of being fully developed physically, mentally, or emotionally
date when a financial obligation becomes due for payment
examples: Her emotional maturity impressed everyone at the interview
The fruit reaches maturity after three months on the tree
The bond reaches maturity in five years from now
Calculate the maturity value of your investment carefully

definitions: heavy hammer with a large head used for driving stakes or wedges
examples: The worker used a maul to split the large logs
A sledge maul drove the fence posts into the ground

definitions: large, impressive building housing a tomb or several tombs
examples: The ancient mausoleum stood majestically on the hillside overlooking the valley
They visited the family mausoleum to pay their respects

definitions: pale purple color with gray or blue tints
examples: She decorated the nursery in soft mauve and cream tones
The mauve sunset reflected beautifully on the lake surface

definitions: person with special knowledge or experience in a particular field
examples: The fashion maven predicted next season's trending styles accurately
She's a maven when it comes to social media marketing

definitions: independent-minded person who refuses to follow conventional rules or practices
unbranded calf or yearling, especially in the American West
examples: The maverick entrepreneur disrupted the entire industry with innovations
Political mavericks often challenge their own party's positions
Cowboys rounded up mavericks during the annual cattle drive
The ranch had several mavericks that needed branding

definitions: stomach of an animal or the throat and gullet
examples: The whale's enormous maw could swallow tons of krill
Food disappeared into the beast's gaping maw instantly

definitions: informal term for maximum amount or upper limit
examples: The elevator holds fifteen people max for safety
You can borrow five books max from the library

definitions: dress, skirt, or coat extending to the ankle
examples: She wore a flowing maxi dress to the beach party
The maxi coat provided warmth during the winter months

definitions: short statement expressing a general truth or rule of conduct
examples: The ancient maxim 'know thyself' remains relevant today
His grandfather lived by the maxim 'measure twice, cut once'

definitions: action or process of making something as large or great as possible
examples: Profit maximization drives many corporate decisions in competitive markets
The algorithm focuses on efficiency maximization across all parameters

definitions: greatest amount, value, or degree that is possible or recorded
upper limit permitted by regulations or physical constraints
examples: The temperature reached a maximum of ninety-five degrees yesterday
Athletes train to achieve maximum performance during competitions
The maximum speed limit on this highway is seventy miles per hour
The elevator has a maximum capacity of twelve people

definitions: fifth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar
flowering shrub or tree of the hawthorn family
examples: The wedding is scheduled for the third Saturday in May
May flowers bloom after April showers bring rain
The white may blossoms covered the hedgerow in spring
Birds nest in the may tree outside our window

definitions: various plants that bloom in May, especially trailing arbutus
ship that transported English Pilgrims to America in 1620
examples: Pink mayflowers carpet the forest floor each spring
The mayflower is the state flower of Massachusetts
The Mayflower carried 102 passengers across the Atlantic Ocean
A replica of the Mayflower sits in Plymouth Harbor

definitions: slender insect with delicate wings living near water, adult stage lasting only hours or days
examples: Mayflies emerged from the river in massive swarms yesterday
The mayfly hatch attracts trout to the surface for feeding

definitions: violent or damaging disorder characterized by chaos and confusion
examples: The concert descended into mayhem when fans rushed the stage
Traffic mayhem followed the unexpected snowstorm downtown yesterday

definitions: informal shortened form of mayonnaise used as condiment
examples: She asked for extra mayo on her turkey sandwich
The potato salad needs more mayo for better consistency

definitions: thick creamy sauce made from egg yolks, oil, and vinegar or lemon juice
examples: Homemade mayonnaise tastes better than store-bought versions
The recipe calls for two tablespoons of mayonnaise

definitions: elected head of a city, town, or municipal government
examples: The mayor announced new infrastructure projects at the press conference
Citizens petitioned the mayor about traffic concerns downtown

definitions: office or position of mayor, or period of serving as mayor
examples: During her mayoralty, the city experienced significant economic growth
The mayoralty election takes place every four years

definitions: decorated pole around which people dance during May Day celebrations
examples: Children danced around the maypole holding colorful ribbons yesterday
The village erected a traditional maypole for the spring festival

definitions: network of paths designed as a puzzle to navigate through
confusing or bewildering situation or collection of things
examples: The corn maze attracted thousands of visitors each autumn
Children love solving the hedge maze in the garden
Navigating the maze of regulations requires professional legal advice
The old city is a maze of narrow winding streets

definitions: lively Polish dance in triple time, or music composed for this dance
examples: The orchestra performed Chopin's mazurka with exceptional grace and energy
Dancers demonstrated the traditional mazurka at the cultural festival

definitions: abbreviation for microgram, one millionth of a gram
examples: The vitamin supplement contains 400 mcg of folic acid
The prescribed dosage is 50 mcg taken twice daily

definitions: alcoholic beverage made by fermenting honey with water
archaic or poetic term for meadow or field
examples: Vikings traditionally drank mead during celebrations and feasts
The craft brewery started producing artisanal mead last year
Sheep grazed peacefully in the verdant mead below
The poet wrote of meads filled with wildflowers

definitions: piece of grassland, especially one used for hay or grazing
examples: Wildflowers bloomed across the alpine meadow in summertime
Cattle grazed peacefully in the meadow beside the stream

definitions: occasion when food is eaten, or the food served and eaten
coarsely ground grain or pulse used as food or animal feed
examples: The family gathered for their evening meal at six o'clock
She prepared a three-course meal for the dinner party
Cornmeal is essential for making traditional Southern cornbread
The miller ground wheat into meal at the watermill

definitions: average value calculated by dividing sum of values by their number
informal term for someone who is unkind or unpleasant
examples: The mean temperature for July was seventy-eight degrees
Calculate the mean, median, and mode of the data set
Don't be such a mean to your little sister
The neighborhood mean never returns children's lost balls

definitions: winding curve or bend of a river or path
examples: The river's meander created a perfect horseshoe shape
Ancient meanders show where the river once flowed differently

definitions: what is meant by a word, text, concept, or action
implied or explicit significance or important quality
examples: The meaning of this ancient symbol remains disputed by scholars
She explained the meaning of the technical terms clearly
His life found new meaning after becoming a teacher
The gift had special meaning because of their shared history

definitions: time between one event and another or while something else happens
examples: In the meantime, we should prepare for the meeting
She studied French and in the meantime worked part-time

definitions: informal childish term for someone who is mean or unkind
examples: The playground meany took everyone's lunch money yesterday
Stop being such a meany to your classmates

definitions: highly contagious viral disease causing fever and red rash on skin
examples: The measles vaccine has prevented millions of childhood deaths worldwide
An outbreak of measles closed the school for two weeks
